column1: - If the biopsy is done without another procedure, the catheter is most often placed through a vein in the neck and then carefully threaded into the heart.
- Once the catheter is in position, a special device with small jaws on the tip is used to remove small pieces of tissue from the heart muscle.
This procedure is routinely done after heart transplantation to watch for signs of rejection.

Your doctor may also order this procedure if you have signs of: - Alcoholic cardiomyopathy - Cardiac amyloidosis - Cardiomyopathy - Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy - Idiopathic cardiomyopathy - Ischemic cardiomyopathy - Myocarditis - Peripartum cardiomyopathy - Restrictive cardiomyopathy
